content.question: A nonlinear spring is used to launch a toy car. The car is pushed against the spring, compressing the spring <math alttext="2.5 centimeters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.5</mn><mtext> cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The force the spring exerts on the car is given by the equation <math alttext="F equals negative K x squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>âˆ’</mo><mi>K</mi><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="K equals 5000 newtons per meter squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>K</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5000</mn><mtext> </mtext><mfrac><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. The potential energy stored in the spring when the car is pushed against it is most nearly

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
